ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Overall, the teaching assistant for this course was accessible, organized, and able to explain concepts clearly and thoroughly.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Christopher Hebdon  He was very organized and knowledgeable about the subject matter.

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The course was very good and I feel that I learned a lot. The one thing that was a bit difficult was the timing of it. I feel that I would have gotten more out of the readings and discussions if the course were spread out over the entire semester.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The professors brought two different view points and levels of expertise, so there was a great deal of knowledge between them and they were each able to compliment the other's lecture.

This is one of the few classes in FES that offers an international perspective on issues. It provides an insight into how the social, cultural and political context of a country shares its legal system which have major influence on how environmental issues are being handled. Extremely valuable for students interested in environmental policy.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: As mentioned above, the fact that it was condensed into two weeks did not lend itself to maximum learning ability and information retention. I was often not able to do all of the readings for the following day.

If the class can be spread over a longer period, it would provide us the opportunity to have more informed discussion. Perhaps over 6 weeks instead of 2 weeks if timing is an issue and Prof Lye's could lecture over 2 or 3 of the 6 weeks or through tele-conferencing.

Students would take so much more from this course if it were taught throughout the semester. The two-week intensive model is very exhausting, and students don't have time to do all the readings and absorb all of the concepts.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Yes. It was effective and the lecturers were able to bring the class into discussing related issues

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This is one of the best classes I have taken in FES!

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this course because I am interested in global environmental law and comparison.
I am interested in environmental policy and this was the only class that offered a non-US perspective which will be helpful in my subsequent career outside the US.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: For the most part, yes. Again, the expedited nature of the course made it a bit difficult sometimes to retain and process information.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: In addition to the two week intensive classes, there one long paper due at the end of the semester. Although the instructors are very good and very knowledgeable, the timing of having the class everyday for two weeks makes it difficult to really gain all the benefits from the course materials.

It is 2 weeks of intensive classes and then a paper to finish throughout the rest of the semester. The lecturers will offer ample help with the help. If this clashes with your other classes, check with the lecturer if you can miss part of the lesson. A really great class!
